items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible today, Sunday 2 November.

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. River levels will remain high over the next couple of days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Monday 3 November 2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Lancashire, North Yorkshire, Westmorland and Furness

items.message:
Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 03 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near to the river Lune, Conder and Keer and other watercourses from Kirkby Lonsdale to Galgate including Gressingham, Carnforth, Hornby, Wray, Bentham and Lancaster. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens and closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 03 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near to the rivers Wyre, Calder and Brock and other watercourses from Abbeystead to Catterall including Scorton, Garstang, Bilsborrow, Ainspool and Churchtown. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and closely monitoring the situation. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 03 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near to the river Wyre, river Cocker, Pilling Water and other watercourses from Catterall to Fleetwood, including St Michaels and Great Eccleston and Preesall. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens and closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the morning of 03 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Rain will continue throughout Monday 3rd of November and into Tuesday. We are currently forecasting the rivers to peak on Monday evening and are not expecting any property flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 03 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near to the river Lune, Rawthey, Dee and other watercourses from Tebay to Kirkby Lonsdale including Sedbergh and Killington. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens and
closely monitoring the situation. 
Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the morning of 03 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Further rain across Monday, 03 of November, and Tuesday will cause the river to rise higher and peak on Tuesday. There is the possibility of property flooding from late on Monday. We will issue flood warnings if required. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible on 02 November 2025 . 

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the upper Derwent and and Derwent Water. Further rain forecast this evening will cause the river to rise higher and we expect to issue the flood warning for Keswick Campsite on Monday the 03/11/2025. 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 03 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near to the rivers Ribble, Hodder and other watercourses, from Settle to Samlesbury including Clitheroe, Gisburn, Sawley, Waddington and Ribchester. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
